ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.prom.v1alpha1.Export.description: Export is the Schema for the exports API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to prom.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to Export

spec.description: ExportSpec defines the desired state of Export

exports.description: Exports is the list of metrics and their sources to be exposed to Prometheus

items.description: Metric defines a metric to be exported

fields.description: An optional set of fields to be exposed by this export.
fields.title: Fields

labels.description:
Labels allows to add labels to the generated metrics,
either statically (predefined set of label/value) or
dynamically based on a path+field
retrieved from EDB.

dynamic.description:
DynamicLabels defines a list of dynamic labels to add to the metrics.
The only supported dynamic source is a path+field from SA.
The regex and replacement are used to extract the Label value from SA response.

field.description: The field name to add as a label
field.title: Field

path.description: The state DB path to export, in the format '.node.srl.interface'
path.title: Path

regex.description: A regular expression to be applied to the field value.
regex.title: Regex

replacement.description: A regular expression replacement to be applied to the field value.
replacement.title: Replacement

dynamic.title: Dynamic Labels

static.description:
StaticLabels defines a list of static labels and values to
be added to the default labels of the generated metric.
static.title: Static Labels

labels.title: Labels

mappings.description:
Mappings are a set of rules used to map metrics values to values
that can be ingested by Prometheus, e.g: DOWN->1, UP->2

destination.description:
Destination defines the new value.
It can be a regular expression with replacement groups.
Its data type must be convertible to a float64.
destination.title: Destination

source.description:
Source defines the value to be mapped.
It can be a regular expression with capture groups.
source.title: Source

mappings.title: Mappings

metricName.description: metric name renaming regex and replacement

regex.description: A regular expression to be applied to the metric name
regex.title: Regex

replacement.description: A regular expression replacement to be applied to the metric name
replacement.title: Replacement

metricName.title: Metric Name

path.description: The state DB path to export, in the format '.namespace.node.srl.interface'
path.title: Path

prefix.description: An optional prefix to add to all metrics exposed by this export, for example 'interface'
prefix.title: Prefix

resource.description:
A Custom resource to be used as a source for the metric.
It will generate a metric with the CR labels and a value of 1.

labels.description:
List of labels to include with the metric.
Include all if not set.
labels.title: Labels

name.description:
CR name to be queried.
Get all of not set.
name.title: Name

namespace.description: The CR namespace, it defaults to all if not specified.
namespace.title: Namespace

version.description: The CR version such as `v1` or `v1alpha1`.
version.title: Version

resource.title: Custom Resource

where.description: A where clause to use for the query, e.g. 'oper-state = down'. You can omit enclosing parentheses.
where.title: Where

exports.title: Exports

group.description: Metric group, defines the collector the metrics belong to.
group.title: Group

spec.title: Specification

status.description: ExportStatus defines the observed state of Export
status.title: Status

Each component must start and end with a lower case alphanumeric character and the body of the component is made up of zero or more lower case alphanumeric and hyphen characters.

delete.description:
Delete all instances of Export.  If Export is a namespaced resource, all instances in all namespaces will
be deleted, and this is restricted to users with the system-administrator role.
If a non-namespaced Export, it deletes all instances of that non-namespaced resource.
